stimulusHtml: A student is given the task of making a calibration curve for CoCl2(aq) for use in a spectrophotometry experiment. The student pours a sample of CoCl2(aq) of known concentration into a cuvette with a 1.0 cm path length and tries to measure the absorbance at 500 nm , which is the wavelength of maximum absorbance. However, the absorbance is too high to give an accurate reading. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step for the student?
choicesHtml: Switching to using a cuvette with a 1.5 cm path length
Repeating the experiment after warming the solution to 40Â°C
Diluting a measured volume of the solution to a new known volume using distilled water
Pouring some solution out of the cuvette
